intro: Phyllobolus delus, commonly known as the deceptive leaf beetle, is a species of leaf beetle belonging to the family Chrysomelidae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped body and a coloration that often mimics the appearance of leaves, providing it with effective camouflage. The beetle's larvae feed on the leaves of various plants, primarily within the Asteraceae family. Its life cycle includes several stages, with adults emerging in the spring to begin the feeding and mating process. Due to its cryptic appearance and ecological role, it plays a part in the natural regulation of plant populations in its habitat.
